wikipedia_page.main: Campbell Gullan (1881, in Glasgow – 1 December 1939, in New York City) was a Scottish actor.

The Black Tulip is a 1937 British, black-and-white historical drama film directed by Alex Bryce and starring Patrick Waddington, Ann Soreen, Campbell Gullan and Bernard Lee.BFI.org The film is based on the novel The Black Tulip by Alexandre Dumas. It was produced by Fox-British Pictures at Wembley Studios as a quota quickie.
* Campbell Gullan – Isaac Boxtel
* Campbell Gullan as Tiser
* Campbell Gullan - Percy Welwyn

Inquest is a 1931 British crime film directed by G.B. Samuelson and starring Campbell Gullan, Mary Glynne, Haddon Mason and Sidney Morgan. It was based on the play by Michael Barringer, which was adapted for film again in 1939.BFI.org
*Norman Dennison KC - 	Campbell Gullan
* Campbell Gullan as D'Artois

The Last Curtain is a 1937 British crime film directed by David MacDonald and starring Campbell Gullan, Kenne Duncan and Greta Gynt.BFI.org The film blends drama and comedy and its plot follows an insurance investigator who examines a series of robberies that have taken place. Much of the action takes place backstage at the fictitious Trafalgar Theatre.
* Campbell Gullan as Sir Alan Masterville
* Campbell Gullan - Veka
* Campbell Gullan as Arnold Grierson

In a contemporary review, Picture Show wrote, "Campbell Gullan as the murderer is good. Gerald Fielding as the journalist plays the part with confidence, and Marjorie Corbett as the daughter of the murderer gives an attractive performance. Entertaining."
* Campbell Gullan as Sir John Rhead
* Campbell Gullan as Sharkey

The Right Element is a 1919 British silent drama film directed by Rex Wilson and starring Campbell Gullan, Miriam Ferris and Tom Reynolds.BFI.org It was based on a story by Roland Pertwee.
* Campbell Gullan - Frank Kemble

A Member of Tattersall's is a 1919 British silent sports film directed by Albert Ward and starring Isobel Elsom, Malcolm Cherry and Campbell Gullan. It was based on a play by H.V. Browning.
* Campbell Gullan - Foxey

A Welsh Singer is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by Henry Edwards and starring Edwards, Campbell Gullan and Florence Turner.BFI.org It was based on the 1896 novel of the same name by Allen Raine. The screenplay concerns a shepherd who falls in love with a girl.
* Campbell Gullan – Tom Pomfrey

Doorsteps is a 1916 British silent drama film directed by Henry Edwards and starring Edwards, Florence Turner and Campbell Gullan. Its plot involves a boarding house maid who befriends a playwright and helps him to evade a dangerous ex-convict on his tail. It was based on a play by Edwards, and was made as a short feature film with a running time of four reels.
* Campbell Gullan – Tozer

The Hotel Mouse is a 1923 British silent crime film directed by Fred Paul and starring Lillian Hall-Davis, Campbell Gullan and Warwick Ward.BFI.org It was based on a play by Paul Armont and Marcel Gerbidon.
* Campbell Gullan - Merchant
Castles in the Air is a 1923 British silent drama film directed by Fred Paul and starring Nelson Keys, Lillian Hall-Davis and Campbell Gullan. It was originally made as Let's Pretend.
* Campbell Gullan
The Right to Strike is a 1923 British silent drama film directed by Fred Paul and starring Lillian Hall-Davis, Fred Paul and Campbell Gullan.BFI.org It was based on a play by Ernest Hutchinson.
* Campbell Gullan as Montague
If Four Walls Told is a 1923 British silent drama film directed by Fred Paul and starring Lillian Hall-Davis, Fred Paul and Campbell Gullan. It was based on a play by Edward Percy.
* Campbell Gullan - David Rysling
Single Life is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Edwin J. Collins and starring Campbell Gullan, Kathleen Vaughan, and Sidney Paxton.BFI.org
* Campbell Gullan - Gerald Hunter

Love in the Wilderness is a 1920 British silent drama film directed by Alexander Butler and starring Madge Titheradge, C.M. Hallard and Campbell Gullan. It was adapted from Gertrude Page's 1907 novel Love in the Wilderness. The film is a romantic melodrama, set partly on a farm in Southern Rhodesia. The film was shot in California.Bamford p.14
* Campbell Gullan as Hon. Dicky Byrd

Damaged Goods is a 1919 British silent drama film directed by Alexander Butler and starring Campbell Gullan, Marjorie Day and J. Fisher White. It was based on the 1901 play Les Aviaries by Eugène Brieux. Because of the play's controversial tackling of the subject of venereal disease, the film had issues with censor boards and attracted a degree of notoriety.Low p.140 The film was described by one reviewer as a "masterpiece".Bamford p.20
* Campbell Gullan as George Dupont

Mr. Pim Passes By is a 1921 British silent comedy film directed by Albert Ward and starring Peggy Hyland, Campbell Gullan and Maudie Dunham. It was based on the 1919 play Mr. Pim Passes By by A.A. Milne.
* Campbell Gullan as Carraway Pim

Her Story is a 1920 British silent drama film directed by Alexander Butler and starring Madge Titheradge, Campbell Gullan, and C. M. Hallard. A happily married woman's life is thrown into turmoil when a Russian criminal from her past escapes from jail and comes to visit her. It was one of several films made by the British producer G. B. Samuelson at Universal City in California.Low p. 139
* Campbell Gullan as Oscar Kaplan
*Campbell Gullan as Tollemache

Caste was adapted for a 1915 British film directed by Laurence Trimble. Sir John Hare made his first appearance in motion pictures, reprising his acclaimed stage portrayal of Eccles. Other cast included Esme Hubbard (Polly Eccles), Campbell Gullan (Sam Gerridge), Peggy Hyland (Esther), Dawson Millward (Captain Hawtree), Roland Pertwee (George d'Alroy) and Mary Rorke (The Marquise) It is believed to be a lost film.

A film was made of the play in 1930; it featured Sebastian Shaw as George d'Alroy and Hermione Baddeley as Polly Eccles, and was directed by Campbell Gullan. Michael Powell (who later made films with Emeric Pressburger) was an additional uncredited director. The period of the play was moved to 1914–15.Caste (1930) Internet Movie database. Accessed Feb 2014.Caste (1930) The Powell and Pressburger Pages. Accessed Feb 2014.
Strangling Threads is a 1923 British silent drama film directed by Cecil M. Hepworth and starring Alma Taylor, Campbell Gullan and James Carew.Gifford p.55

The Honeypot is a 1920 British silent romance film directed by Fred LeRoy Granville and starring Peggy Hyland, Campbell Gullan and James Lindsay.Low p.383 It was made at Isleworth Studios. A sequel Love Maggy was released the following year.
* Campbell Gullan as Lord Chalfont

Love Maggy is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Fred LeRoy Granville and starring Peggy Hyland, Campbell Gullan and James Lindsay.Quinlan p.121 It was made at Isleworth Studios as a sequel to the 1920 film The Honeypot.
* Campbell Gullan as Lord Chalfont
* Campbell Gullan as Edward Travers
